Field.Name: ALL
Field.Description: All terms from all searchable fields

Field.Name: UID
Field.Description: Unique number assigned to publication

Field.Name: FILT
Field.Description: Limits the records

Field.Name: SRC
Field.Description: Name of the organization that is the source of the record

Field.Name: SRID
Field.Description: A numerical id that is assigned to a particular source of biosystem records

Field.Name: TYPE
Field.Description: Type of the biosystem

Field.Name: PDAT
Field.Description: The date the biosystem record first appeared in the NCBI biosystems database

Field.Name: MDAT
Field.Description: The date the biosystem record last changed in the NCBI biosystems database

Field.Name: SACC
Field.Description: The accession used by the source of the biosystem

Field.Name: TITL
Field.Description: The name of the biosystem

Field.Name: DESC
Field.Description: The text description of a biosystem

Field.Name: COM
Field.Description: Comments on the biosystem

Field.Name: ORGN
Field.Description: Organism that contain the biosystem

Field.Name: PN
Field.Description: Names of proteins in a biosystem (definition line)

Field.Name: CN
Field.Description: Names of small molecules in a biosystem (taken from PubChem)

Field.Name: SEID
Field.Description: Id given to a small molecule by the source of a biosystem

Field.Name: GN
Field.Description: Gene name

Field.Name: GEID
Field.Description: Id given to a gene by the source of a biosystem

Field.Name: PID
Field.Description: Protein accessions and gis in a biosystem

Field.Name: CID
Field.Description: PubChem compound identifiers (cid) found in a biosystem

Field.Name: GID
Field.Description: NCBI gene ids found in a biosystem

Field.Name: SID
Field.Description: PubChem substance ids (sid) found in a biosystem

Field.Name: ACCN
Field.Description: The biosystem accession (bsid plus version)

Field.Name: SCT
Field.Description: Total Count of PubChem substance ids (sid) found in a biosystem

Field.Name: CCT
Field.Description: Total Count of PubChem compound ids (cid) found in a biosystem

Field.Name: GCT
Field.Description: Total Count of NCBI Gene records (geneid) found in a biosystem

Field.Name: PCT
Field.Description: Total Count of NCBI Protein records (gi) found in a biosystem

Link.Name: biosystems_biosystems_conserved
Link.Description: The conserved biosystem, if one is available, that corresponds to an organism specific biosystem. Conserved biosystems are canonical biosystems that are used to group together orthologous, organism specific biosystems.

Link.Name: biosystems_biosystems_linked
Link.Description: Biosystems that the source database has explicitly stated are connected in some way.

Link.Name: biosystems_biosystems_similar
Link.Description: Biosystems share at least one identical protein sequence from the same source organism. In other words, the shared protein is in the same protein identity group ("PIG," a group of proteins that are identical in sequence) and has the same Taxonomy ID.

Link.Name: biosystems_biosystems_specific
Link.Description: The organism specific biosystems that correspond to a conserved biosystem, as determined by the source database.

Link.Name: biosystems_biosystems_sub
Link.Description: Biosystems that are one node below the one currently being viewed, according to a hierarchical organization used by the source database.

Link.Name: biosystems_biosystems_super
Link.Description: Biosystems that are one node above the one currently being viewed, according to a hierarchical organization used by the source database.

Link.Name: biosystems_cdd_specific
Link.Description: Conserved domains that are specific hits to the proteins involved in biosystems, representing high confidence functional annotations. The association between the proteins and biosystems was made using the method described in the data processing section of the BioSystems help document.

Link.Name: biosystems_gene_all
Link.Description: Genes contained in the BioSystem

Link.Name: biosystems_homologene
Link.Description: HomoloGene records that are linked to the proteins involved in the biosystem. The HomoloGene records list putative orthologs of the genes that coded the proteins. The association between proteins and biosystems was made using the method descibed in the data processing section of the BioSystems help document.

Link.Name: biosystems_nuccore
Link.Description: Nucleotides

Link.Name: biosystems_omim
Link.Description: Records from the Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man (OMIM) database that are linked to the Entrez Gene records associated with a BioSystem. The association between genes and biosystems was made using the method descibed in the data processing section of the BioSystems help document.

Link.Name: biosystems_pcassay_active
Link.Description: BioAssays in which compounds from biosystems have been found to be active. The association between the compounds and biosystems was made using the method described in the data processing section of the BioSystems help document.

Link.Name: biosystems_pcassay_target
Link.Description: BioAssays whose protein targets are involved in biosystems. The association between the proteins and biosystems was made using the method described in the data processing section of the BioSystems help document.

Link.Name: biosystems_pccompound
Link.Description: Compounds involved in biosystems. The association between the compounds and biosystems was made using the method described in the data processing section of the BioSystems help document.

Link.Name: biosystems_pcsubstance
Link.Description: Substances involved in biosystems. The association between the substances and biosystems was made using the method described in the data processing section of the BioSystems help document.

Link.Name: biosystems_protein
Link.Description: Proteins involved in biosystems. The association between the proteins and biosystems was made using the method described in the data processing section of the BioSystems help document.

Link.Name: biosystems_proteinclusters
Link.Description: Protein Clusters database records that are linked to the proteins involved in the biosystem. The association between the proteins and biosystems was made using the method described in the data processing section of the BioSystems help document. The Protein Clusters database contains both curated and uncurated clusters of proteins (from four major groups: prokaryotes, bacteriophages and the mitochondrial and chloroplast organelles) that are grouped by sequence similarity.

Link.Name: biosystems_pubmed
Link.Description: PubMed articles describing biosystems. These are PubMed records whose PMIDs were explicitly cited in the source database biosystem record.

Link.Name: biosystems_structure
Link.Description: 3D macromolecular structures of proteins involved in biosystems. The association between the proteins and biosystems was made using the method described in the data processing section of the BioSystems help document.

Link.Name: biosystems_taxonomy
Link.Description: The source organisms of the biosytems, whose Taxonomy IDs were provided in the biosystem records deposited by the source database. For additional information, see the data processing/taxonomy section of the BioSystems help document.
